column1: # Scientific Justification: Three distributaries are long enough (>60 km)
# to support independent salt intrusion and require separate representation
#   - Flow split: Jordan et al. (2019) - 60% of total Mekong discharge
#   - Bifurcation location: My Thuan / Vinh Long area
#   - 5-10 for mangrove/tidal flat areas (increases storage capacity)
# 1. Tien Main Stem: Tan Chau (Node 1) to My Thuan Split (Node 2)
# Length: 100 km (Tan Chau gauge to first major bifurcation)
# 2. Ham Luong Branch: Split (Node 2) to Ham Luong Mouth (Node 3)
# Length: 85 km (merged small creeks into main channel)
# 3. Co Chien Branch: Split (Node 2) to Co Chien Mouth (Node 4)
# Length: 82 km (merged Cung Hau mouth into Co Chien)
# 4. My Tho Branch: Split (Node 2) to My Tho Mouth (Node 5)
# Length: 65 km (represents Cua Dai / Cua Tieu merged)
